titleStmt.title: Clinton Butts et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10039

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Covington Jany 25th 1861
To his Excellency
Beriah Magoffin
Govenor of the State of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Kenton County Ky do respectfully pray that your Honor may remit the fine of $50 imposed on Jacob Metz at the last term of the Kenton Circuit Court for carrying concealed weapons We think the case is one in which executive clemency can be justly used.

Clinton Butts
Wm E Wade
A. H. Jameson
Geo. F. Smith
Joe Clark
E. H. howard
C T Allen
Jno E Hamilton
J M Ranken
O. B. Landford
Caleb. Broomall
Henry Zell
L. D. Croninger,
Samuel. B. Laird
J. H. Brown
L C Rankin
R. G. Warrington
Wm Everson
J. Musselman
John B Carey
C A. Withers
C Beam
B W Foley

Kenton Cir ct
Respite 12 mo
B. M
$50 } Weapons
Jacob Metz
Issd April 9. 1861
